analyzed: bkod nas snying rje can gyis sgo la sogs pa yang dag par yang bya //
translated: and the compassionate one should also properly perform the door and so forth.

analyzed: dam pa'i tsandan sogs bkrus dri zhim me tog bkram pa'i mchog cha la //
translated: The supreme fragrance of the sandalwood and so forth of the holy ones is spread by the water of the flowers of the bath.🔽

analyzed: bsam gtan gnas su bde ba'i gnas su 'dug nas dus gsum sangs rgyas rnams //
translated: In a place of meditation, in a pleasant dwelling, having first made offerings to the Buddhas of the three times,

analyzed: dmigs te sna tshogs mchod sprin spro sogs sngon du byas nas blo ldan pas //
translated: Having created clouds of various offerings, and so on, the wise one

analyzed: thog ma med ldan srid pa'i rgyun la rtog pas bsags pa'i sdig kun gang //

analyzed: snying rje chen po'i mdun rim bzhin te thams cad bshags par bgyi //
translated: I confess them all in the presence of the Greatly Compassionate One.

analyzed: yang dag sangs rgyas byang chub 'phags dang gzhan rnams mdzad pa'i dge ba gang //
translated: Whatever virtue there is of the perfect Buddhas, the noble Bodhisattvas, and others,

analyzed: ma lus bdag gis yi rang yang dag de ni byang chub phyir bsngo'o // sems rgyas zla ba dri ma med las grub pas mtha' yas snying rje gnas //
translated: I rejoice in all of it, and I dedicate it to enlightenment.🔽I go for refuge to the Sugatas, who are the abode of infinite compassion,

analyzed: bdag gi yid la gnas pa'i bde bar gshegs la rtag tu skyabs su mchi //
translated: Who are born from the moon of the mind, which is stainless and full.

analyzed: rtog pa kun las nges grol ma lus dam pa sems dpa'i bkra shis gzhi //
translated: The auspicious ground of the bodhisattva, completely liberated from all conceptual thoughts, is the ultimate.

original: dngos po kun gyi ngo bor chos la bdag nyid skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi ngo bor chos la bdag nyid skyabs su mchi //
translated: I go for refuge to the Dharma, the nature of all things.🔽I go for refuge to the assembly of bodhisattvas, who are glorious,

analyzed: bcings pas yang dag spangs pa'i snying rje mchog gis drangs pa'i dpal ldan pa //
translated: drawn by the supreme compassion that completely abandons bondage.

translated: I go for refuge to the assembly of bodhisattvas, who abide on the stages of Perfect Joy and so forth.🔽With a mind adorned by interest, I generate the awakening mind,

analyzed: mos pas rnam par brgyan pa'i sems kyis byang chub sems ni bskyed par bgyi //
translated: which is the complete ripening of the intention, the conqueror of all obscurations and habitual tendencies.

analyzed: bde gshegs sras bcas lam gcig sbyin sogs bcu po dkar po yon tan ngo bo la //
translated: I rely on the path of the Sugatas and their children, the essence of the ten virtues such as generosity,

analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas dag kun gyi rang bzhin blo yis de ltar bsten par bgyi //
translated: which is the nature of all perfect buddhas.

analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dag lta ba'i dra bas bkab la snying rjes dmigs nas su //
translated: With compassion as the focus, I see that these worlds are veiled by the net of views.

original: yang dag byang chub sems kyi gzhal med bsgom rim 'di ni sngags pas bya //
analyzed: yang dag byang chub sems kyi gzhal med bsgom rim 'di ni sngags pas bya //
translated: The yogin should meditate on the celestial palace of the utterly pure mind of enlightenment.

original: stong pa rang bzhin med phyir rgyu 'bras phyir ni rang bzhin mtshan ma med //🔽rjes @37a * //
analyzed: stong pa rang bzhin med phyir rgyu 'bras phyir ni rang bzhin mtshan ma med // rjes @37a * //
translated: Since emptiness is essenceless, cause and effect are essenceless and signless.

original: su dpag pa bsal bas ma lus gzhi yi smon pa nges bral lo //
analyzed: su dpag pa bsal bas ma lus gzhi yi smon pa nges bral lo //
translated: Since inference is eliminated, the ground is definitely free from all wishes.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Oṃ śūnyatājñānavajrasvabhāvātmako ’haṃ

analyzed: de 'og ston zla dkar bo mtha' med phyogs 'khor gnas pa sna tshogs 'od //
translated: Then, the endless autumn moon, the abode of the directions, is the multicolored light.

original: 'phags par gnas pa'i gru gsum nang gi mkha' yi rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: 'phags par gnas pa'i gru gsum nang gi mkha' yi rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: The nature of the space in the interior of the triangular noble abode is Vajradhara.

analyzed: chos kyi 'byung zhes phyag rgya dbus gnas padma sna tshogs rdo rjes brgyan //
translated: The abode of phenomena is the mudra in the center, adorned with a multicolored lotus and vajra cross.

analyzed: h'um gis rdo rje brgyan pa'i sa la kun du bzang po las byung bsgom //

analyzed: bhr'um yig 'khor lo las byung rig ma dang bcas snang mdzad skur gyur pa //
translated: The knowledge consort arises from the syllable bhrūṃ and the wheel, and the form of Vairocana arises.

analyzed: gsal ba thub dbang dkyil 'khor sna tshogs 'od zer gyis khyab phyogs 'khor kun //
translated: The light of the various mandalas of the lords of the sages pervades all directions.

original: gru bzhi mnyam pa'i phyir na mchog bzhis dran pa dbang po sgo rnams kyis //
analyzed: gru bzhi mnyam pa'i phyir na mchog bzhis dran pa dbang po sgo rnams kyis //
translated: Because it is square and even, the four supreme [meditative concentrations] are the doors of the faculties of mindfulness.

analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi yi tva ra na ting 'dzin mu khyud bzhi yis yongs bskor ba //
translated: It is completely surrounded by the four circular bands of the four meditative concentrations and the samādhi of the tvaṃ tvaṃ sound.

analyzed: mu khyud de la gnas pa dam pa'i mchod pas 'brel ba'i gzugs rnams rgyun //

analyzed: sna tshogs rgyan rnams bkod pa 'gro ba'i bsam pa thams cad yongs rdzogs phyir ;

analyzed: /'dul bas bskyod pa gsung rab yan lag dgu yi dam chos kun 'gro ci yi phyir //

analyzed: rlung gis bskyod pa rgyal mtshan phreng dang dril sgra grag pas phyogs sgo kun //
translated: The sound of the garlands and bells on the victory banners moving due to the wind resounds in all directions.

analyzed: me long ye shes rtag tu dri med byang chub yan lag me tog sbos bkram zhing //
translated: The mirror-like wisdom is always stainless, and the flowers of the branches of enlightenment are scattered.

analyzed: dra ba dra phyed me long me tog phreng ba sna tshogs brgyan pa'i gzugs //
translated: The forms adorned with various nets, half-nets, mirrors, and flower garlands

analyzed: rnam par thar brgyad rnam par dag pas ka ba brgyad kyis klubs pa'i mchog / rdo rje tshul gyis chos kyi 'khor los sgyur phyir rdo rje'i thig ldan la //
translated: It has vajra-lines, because it is the turning of the wheel of the Dharma by the vajra-method.

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i spyod yul dag pas bla med mtha' yas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga //
translated: It has the five boundless, supreme, desired qualities, because of the purity of the objects of form and so forth.

analyzed: zas lngas brgyan pas rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings rgyu mthun //
translated: It is the cause of the pure dharmadhātu, because it is adorned with the five nectars.

analyzed: sna tshogs padma la gnas nyi ma zla bar bcas pa lha yi gdan //

analyzed: ma lus rin chen bkod pa'i gzhal yas brtsegs pa de la bsgom //

analyzed: bcu drug cha shas sde pa las byung zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ba yi dbus //

analyzed: dbus kyi gdan la cho ga bzhin du 'od dpag med gzhi bsam par bya //
translated: one should imagine, on the central seat, Amitābha, according to the rite.

analyzed: mchog gi dang po'i snying po las byung rdo rje dam pa ye shes gzugs //

analyzed: grangs med thug pa'i 'od zer phreng bas grub pa'i phyogs sgo kun //
translated: the direction and corners of the mandala are accomplished by the garland of light rays that reach to the end of the numberless.

analyzed: bsams nas dang po'i snying por bcas pa'i nga rgyal ldan pas sbrul pa mtha' yas kyis //
translated: Having contemplated, with the pride of possessing the essence of the first, one should emanate infinitely.

analyzed: 'gro ba'i don mchog rab mdzad pa yi thugs mchog rdul phran rnam bkod gzugs @37b brnyan can //

analyzed: lhag ma'i phyag zung gnyis brgyan rdo rje ral gri rin chen padma 'dzin //
translated: the remaining two pairs of hands holding the ornaments, vajra, sword, jewel, and lotus,

analyzed: 'jig rten gsum khong brgyan pa'i 'od zer rnam pa bde 'gro thub pa'i dbang //
translated: the light rays that adorn the three worlds, the lord of the path to the higher realms,

analyzed: rnam thar gsum dag shes rab bdag nyid snying rje'i mchog gi thabs ldan pas //
translated: the one who possesses the wisdom of the three liberations, the supreme compassion, and the method,

analyzed: 'gro kun de nyid gcig pa rgyal ba skyed byed sku bzhi mngon sum bya //
translated: having made manifest the four bodies that produce the one suchness of all beings, the Victorious One,

analyzed: mchog tu rjes chags phun sum tshogs pas 'jig rten thams cad 'dul dmigs nas //
translated: having observed the entire world to be tamed by the perfection of supreme passion,

analyzed: dga' ba'i rdzu 'phrul sgra yis rgyal ba'i tshogs rnams rang gi lus nang bzhugs //
translated: The assembly of victors, by the sound of the magic of joy, enter into one’s body.

analyzed: de ni spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo gzugs sogs yul gyi rang bzhin pas //
translated: Those goddesses, such as Locanā, are the nature of the objects such as form.

analyzed: phyung nas rig ma thams cad gzhi yi rig ma'i nang du thim par bya //
translated: Having emanated, all the knowledge goddesses dissolve into the basic knowledge goddesses.

analyzed: de yi padma'i snying po'i dbus su dkyil 'khor dri med zla 'od las byung ba //
translated: In the center of the heart of her lotus, the stainless mandala arises from the light of the moon.

analyzed: blo yis bsams nas rdzogs par bde la skye bo'i tshogs rnams gzhug par bya //
translated: Having imagined it with the mind, one should cause the assembly of beings to enter into the perfect bliss.

analyzed: dam pa gsang ba'i rdo rje dkyil 'khor rnam snang mdzad sogs rgyal ba'i rgyan zhugs nas //
translated: The supreme secret vajra mandala is entered by the ornaments of the victors, such as Vairocana.

analyzed: zla ba zhu ba'i ngo bor gyur pas dbang bskur byas te de 'og tu //
translated: Having become the essence of the melted moon, they are empowered, and then

analyzed: sa snying phyag na rdo rje nam snying 'jig rten dbang phyug sgrib pa sel //
translated: Kṣitigarbha, Vajrapāṇi, Ākāśagarbha, Lokêśvara, and Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin

analyzed: dpal ldan kun du bzang po de dag mig la sogs pa'i grangs su gyur //
translated: become the glorious Samantabhadra, counted as the eye, and so on.

analyzed: gzugs sgra de dang ro dang reg bya chos dbyings rdo rje yang //
translated: Form, sound, taste, touch, and the phenomena-realm vajra

analyzed: sa chu me rlung rang bzhin gyur pa spyan la sogs pa'i grangs 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gzugs dang myong ba mtshan ma de bzhin kho na 'du byed yid brjod pas //

analyzed: rnam snang mdzad sogs bde gshegs rnams te de 'og sa bon gyis dbyung bya //

original: sku yi dbang phyug bzhin du phyag la sogs pa drag po gzhan gyis mi thub gsal //
analyzed: sku yi dbang phyug bzhin du phyag la sogs pa drag po gzhan gyis mi thub gsal //
translated: The lord of the body, like the face, is the clear other invincible wrathful one.

original: de nas rta mgrin nub kyi phyogs su sgo ru 'od zer 'khrigs pas phyogs bskor ba //
analyzed: de nas rta mgrin nub kyi phyogs su sgo ru 'od zer 'khrigs pas phyogs bskor ba //
translated: Then, in the western door, Hayagriva, who is surrounded by a mass of light,

original: padm'anta kri ta ces pas 'bar ba'i 'jig pa'i me ltar 'jigs pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: padm'anta kri ta ces pas 'bar ba'i 'jig pa'i me ltar 'jigs pa'i gzugs //
translated: is Padmantakrita, who is called Padmantakrita, and has a terrifying form like the fire of destruction.

original: gsung gi bzhin du phyag la sogs pa du mas sdang ba 'jigs byed zhal //
analyzed: gsung gi bzhin du phyag la sogs pa du mas sdang ba 'jigs byed zhal //
translated: The face of speech, like the face, is the terrifying face of many hands and so forth.

original: gad sgrogs bzhad pas ri rnams g-yo bar byed dang thub pa'i dbang rnams so //
analyzed: gad sgrogs bzhad pas ri rnams g-yo bar byed dang thub pa'i dbang rnams so //
translated: The laughter of the herukas causes the mountains to shake.

original: de nas mi bskyod 'dra ba'i zhal sogs bishn'a nta kri ta ces bya byang sgo ru //
analyzed: de nas mi bskyod 'dra ba'i zhal sogs bishn'a nta kri ta ces bya byang sgo ru //
translated: Then, in the northern gate, the face of Akṣobhya and so forth, Viṣṇu, Nṛsiṃha, and so on,

original: zad dus byin za lta bu @39b 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil pa dpa' ba'o //
analyzed: zad dus byin za lta bu @39b 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil pa dpa' ba'o //
translated: and in the southeast, Yama, the color of the time of destruction, is the hero Ārya-Amṛtakuṇḍali.🔽Vairocana, the lord of sages, Amitābha, and the lord of mind are the crown ornaments,

original: rnam snang mdzad dang thub dbang snang ba mtha' yas thugs kyi dbang phyug dbu rgyan dang // rim par tho ba be con padma rdo rje la sogs phyag kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam snang mdzad dang thub dbang snang ba mtha' yas thugs kyi dbang phyug dbu rgyan dang // rim par tho ba be con padma rdo rje la sogs phyag kyang de bzhin no //
translated: and the hammer, club, lotus, vajra, and so on, are the hands, respectively.

original: de ltar rdzogs par bskyed par dkyil 'khor mthong nas dngos po thams cad kyis //
analyzed: de ltar rdzogs par bskyed par dkyil 'khor mthong nas dngos po thams cad kyis //
translated: Having seen the maṇḍala generated in this way, all things

original: snying po sngags kyi 'od zer lcags kyus bde gshegs spyan drangs bsgom par bya //
analyzed: snying po sngags kyi 'od zer lcags kyus bde gshegs spyan drangs bsgom par bya //
translated: are visualized with the light rays of the essence mantra hook, inviting the sugatas.

original: thabs dang shes rab dngos bo dri med ting 'dzin las byung dam pa'i bde bas gsang bar ni //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab dngos bo dri med ting 'dzin las byung dam pa'i bde bas gsang bar ni //
translated: The secret is the pure substance of method and wisdom, the sublime bliss arisen from samādhi.

original: dkyil 'khor bsams te de nas thar byed la sogs bsrung byas nas //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bsams te de nas thar byed la sogs bsrung byas nas //
translated: Having visualized the maṇḍala, then one should perform the protection with the liberation and so on.

original: rang snying bzlas pa'i tsandan sogs dang me tog mdzes pa phul te thim //
analyzed: rang snying bzlas pa'i tsandan sogs dang me tog mdzes pa phul te thim //
translated: Offer beautiful flowers and sandalwood paste, etc., which are the essence of your heart mantra, and dissolve.

original: rang dang 'dra ba'i cho gas dbang bskur byas nas 'di ltar nan tan mchod par bya //
analyzed: rang dang 'dra ba'i cho gas dbang bskur byas nas 'di ltar nan tan mchod par bya //
translated: Having conferred empowerment with a rite similar to your own, make offerings with this kind of effort.

original: padma'i nang gi rang gi sa bon 'od kyis drangs nas gzugs sogs thams cad ni //
analyzed: padma'i nang gi rang gi sa bon 'od kyis drangs nas gzugs sogs thams cad ni //
translated: The light of your seed syllable in the lotus draws forth all forms, etc.

original: padma'i 'od zer dkyil 'khor yang dag byang chub yid kyi sa bon bsam par bya //
analyzed: padma'i 'od zer dkyil 'khor yang dag byang chub yid kyi sa bon bsam par bya //
translated: The light rays of the lotus mandala are the seed syllable of the mind of perfect enlightenment.

original: shes rab so so'i ba spu'i las byung sna tshogs rnam pa'i 'od zer rgyas pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: shes rab so so'i ba spu'i las byung sna tshogs rnam pa'i 'od zer rgyas pa'i tshogs //
translated: The light rays of various aspects emanate from the pores of wisdom.

original: ma lus khyab pa'i mkha' gzhi thams cad de nas blo dang ldan pas spro bar bya //
analyzed: ma lus khyab pa'i mkha' gzhi thams cad de nas blo dang ldan pas spro bar bya //
translated: Then the wise one should emanate the entire space element that pervades everywhere.

original: 'od zer sgo nas byung ba'i dri med thams cad rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan sku dang // me long pi wang dri dang ro yi snod dang na bza' chos 'byung la sogs dang // mtshan ma rnams kyi rim pas mdzes pas ldem bag phyag ni lo ma 'od dang bcas //
analyzed: 'od zer sgo nas byung ba'i dri med thams cad rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan sku dang // me long pi wang dri dang ro yi snod dang na bza' chos 'byung la sogs dang // mtshan ma rnams kyi rim pas mdzes pas ldem bag phyag ni lo ma 'od dang bcas //
translated: All the stainless things that come from light rays are well adorned with ornaments, and the body🔽is beautiful with the marks of a mirror, lute, perfume, food, clothing, and a source of Dharma, and so on.🔽The hands are graceful with light rays and leaves, and from the clear light rays come many emanations, clouds of various offerings, and nets.

original: gsal ba'i 'od zer sbrul pa mang po sna tshogs mchod pa'i sprin gyi dra ba rnams 'byung dang // sgyu ma la sogs dra ba'i dngos po so so yang dag rig pa'i 'jig rten lta dge dang // rtog pa thams cad nges grol mchog gi bde ba 'byung rgyu'i dngos ldan pa'i //
analyzed: gsal ba'i 'od zer sbrul pa mang po sna tshogs mchod pa'i sprin gyi dra ba rnams 'byung dang // sgyu ma la sogs dra ba'i dngos po so so yang dag rig pa'i 'jig rten lta dge dang // rtog pa thams cad nges grol mchog gi bde ba 'byung rgyu'i dngos ldan pa'i //
translated: The things of the nets of illusion and so on are the perfect knowledges, and the world is seen as virtuous.🔽All concepts are definitely freed, and the supreme bliss that arises is the true nature.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyis de bzhin phyi ma'i dri sogs thams cad kyis //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyis de bzhin phyi ma'i dri sogs thams cad kyis //
translated: The goddesses of form and so on, and likewise all the outer smells and so on,

original: dbye ba'i rtog pa grol bas rgyal ba'i dbang po rnams la yang dag mchod par bya //
analyzed: dbye ba'i rtog pa grol bas rgyal ba'i dbang po rnams la yang dag mchod par bya //
translated: are offered to the lords of the victorious ones through the freedom from the concepts of division.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Oṃ, I am the vajra nature of the offering to all the tathāgatas.

original: de yi 'og tu sgra brnyan 'dra bar sgra yul thams cad la ni yod bsams na //
analyzed: de yi 'og tu sgra brnyan 'dra bar sgra yul thams cad la ni yod bsams na //
translated: Then, thinking that all sounds exist in the object of sound like an echo,

original: rang yid rig pa'i lha yi stod pa'i sgra dang ldan pa'i chos rnams zhes su gsungs //
analyzed: rang yid rig pa'i lha yi stod pa'i sgra dang ldan pa'i chos rnams zhes su gsungs //
translated: The Dharma is said to be endowed with the sound of the deity’s praise that arises from one’s own mind.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gcig min rdul phran cha yang ma mthong du ma'i gzugs kyang ma yin zhes pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gcig min rdul phran cha yang ma mthong du ma'i gzugs kyang ma yin zhes pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as it is said that form and so on is neither one nor many,

original: yan lag med pa'i rdul phran nyid la du ma'i rdul phra rab kyi rjes 'brang med phyir dang // sa yi dkyil 'khor la @40a * //
analyzed: yan lag med pa'i rdul phran nyid la du ma'i rdul phra rab kyi rjes 'brang med phyir dang // sa yi dkyil 'khor la @40a * //
translated: Because the partless atom itself has no parts, and because a multiple atom is not found,

original: sogs gzugs kyi dbye bas de la 'ga' yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs gzugs kyi dbye bas de la 'ga' yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The parts of form and so on are not established.

original: de bas 'dzin pa la sogs bral bas rang dbang gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags ngo bo yin //
analyzed: de bas 'dzin pa la sogs bral bas rang dbang gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags ngo bo yin //
translated: Therefore, because of being free from grasping and so on, the imagined nature is the independent nature of form and so on.

original: ma lus g-yo dang mi g-yo'i dngos bo dri za'i grong khyer dag dang 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: ma lus g-yo dang mi g-yo'i dngos bo dri za'i grong khyer dag dang 'dra ba yin //
translated: All things, moving and unmoving, are like a city of gandharvas.

original: bdag gir 'dzin pa'i rtog pa'i rgyun gyi ngo bos 'khor ba 'di dag ste //
analyzed: bdag gir 'dzin pa'i rtog pa'i rgyun gyi ngo bos 'khor ba 'di dag ste //
translated: The world is the continuity of the thought of self-existence and of self-possession.

original: dag pa yang ni de las ldog pa'i ngo bo tsam la rnam par shes par bya //
analyzed: dag pa yang ni de las ldog pa'i ngo bo tsam la rnam par shes par bya //
translated: And purity is the mere reversal of that.

original: chos nyid kyis ni srid dang zhi ba'i ngo bo 'dir ni dbye ba 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis ni srid dang zhi ba'i ngo bo 'dir ni dbye ba 'ga' yang med //
translated: By the nature of things, there is no distinction whatever between existence and peace.

original: ci'i phyir 'dzin pa la sogs rnam par bral ba rtag tu kun la sgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dzin pa la sogs rnam par bral ba rtag tu kun la sgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: Why? Because of the constant practice of the absence of grasping, etc.

original: thams cad 'ga' yang med de so sor snang ba'i rang bzhin rtog pa las //
analyzed: thams cad 'ga' yang med de so sor snang ba'i rang bzhin rtog pa las //
translated: Nothing exists, and the nature of the individual appearances is only imagination.

original: sems las gzhan du gyur pa'i nga zhes 'ga' yang med de de phyir bdag kyang de //
analyzed: sems las gzhan du gyur pa'i nga zhes 'ga' yang med de de phyir bdag kyang de //
translated: There is no “I” apart from the mind, and therefore the self is also that.

original: gang gi ngo bo gang yin de yis de nyid rtogs pa'i gzhi ste ci phyir dngos //
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo gang yin de yis de nyid rtogs pa'i gzhi ste ci phyir dngos //
translated: The nature of something is the basis of the knowledge of that. Why is it so?

original: de bas thams cad dbyer med shes te dngos po thams cad dbyer med ba nyid yin //
analyzed: de bas thams cad dbyer med shes te dngos po thams cad dbyer med ba nyid yin //
translated: Therefore, everything is indivisible, and all things are indivisibility itself.

original: kha cig yul dang kha cig gzhan du snang bar rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhig gis //
analyzed: kha cig yul dang kha cig gzhan du snang bar rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhig gis //
translated: Some understand that the appearance is in the object, and others that it is in the mind.

original: de dang de yi bral dang bral ba'i phyir te de phyis thams cad ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang de yi bral dang bral ba'i phyir te de phyis thams cad ma yin no //
translated: And because of being free from that and that, it is not everything later.

original: dang dang brtson 'grus rnam par dag pa de bzhin dran pa bsam gtan dag pas kyang //
analyzed: dang dang brtson 'grus rnam par dag pa de bzhin dran pa bsam gtan dag pas kyang //
translated: And with the purity of faith and diligence, and likewise with the purity of mindfulness and concentration,

original: dam pa'i sgo srung gzugs te shes rab rnam par dag pas thams cad yul du snang //
analyzed: dam pa'i sgo srung gzugs te shes rab rnam par dag pas thams cad yul du snang //
translated: The doorkeeper of the sacred place is form, and with the purity of wisdom, everything appears as an object.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i dag pa thams cad dag pas lha mo tshogs kyi rang bzhin dang // thams cad don dang bdag po rnam par rtog pa rab tu 'jug pa rnam par dag pa yis //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i dag pa thams cad dag pas lha mo tshogs kyi rang bzhin dang // thams cad don dang bdag po rnam par rtog pa rab tu 'jug pa rnam par dag pa yis //
translated: With the purity of all that is signless, the nature of the assembly of goddesses, and with the purity of the engagement of the concepts of all meanings and lords,

original: me long la sogs mkha' chen po //
analyzed: me long la sogs mkha' chen po //
translated: The mirror and so on are the great space.

original: rdo rje gsum mchog dkyil 'khor gsum //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum mchog dkyil 'khor gsum //
translated: The three mandalas of the three supreme vajras,

original: rdo rje dbyangs la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyangs la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the vajra melody.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dag pa che //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dag pa che //
translated: Vairocana, the great purity,

original: rdo rje zhi ba dga' ba che //
analyzed: rdo rje zhi ba dga' ba che //
translated: Vajra peace, the great joy,

original: rang bzhin gyis ni 'od gsal mchog / ston pa rdo rje phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni 'od gsal mchog / ston pa rdo rje phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: The supreme natural luminosity, Homage to the teacher Vajra.

original: rin chen rgyal po rab tu zab //
analyzed: rin chen rgyal po rab tu zab //
translated: The precious king, very profound,

original: rdo rje nam mkha' dri ma med //
analyzed: rdo rje nam mkha' dri ma med //
translated: The vajra space, stainless,

original: dngos nyid dag pas gos pa med //
analyzed: dngos nyid dag pas gos pa med //
translated: Since it is pure by nature, it is unstained.

original: rdo rje sku la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje sku la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the vajra body.

original: rdo rje mi 'chi 'dod chags che //
analyzed: rdo rje mi 'chi 'dod chags che //
translated: Vajra immortality is great passion,

original: me rtog nam mkha'i rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: me rtog nam mkha'i rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: the blazing fire, the vajra holder of space,

original: 'dod chags pha rol phyin pa brnyes //
analyzed: 'dod chags pha rol phyin pa brnyes //
translated: having attained the perfection of passion.

original: rdo rje gsung la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje gsung la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to vajra speech.

original: don yod rdo rje rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: don yod rdo rje rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: Vajra Amoghasiddhi is perfect buddhahood,

original: bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i //
translated: the complete fulfillment of all wishes,

original: dag pa ngo bo nyid las byung //
analyzed: dag pa ngo bo nyid las byung //
translated: arising from the nature of purity.

original: rdo rje sems la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje sems la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to vajra mind.

original: phyag 'tshal 'bar bas byin gyis brlabs pa'i rlung me'i dkyil @40b 'khor gnas 'bar ba'i //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal 'bar bas byin gyis brlabs pa'i rlung me'i dkyil @40b 'khor gnas 'bar ba'i //
translated: Homage to the blazing consecrated wind-fire mandala,

original: bdud rtsi lnga la de nas 'bru gsum bzlas pa'i dkyil nas grangs med thub pa'i dbang //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga la de nas 'bru gsum bzlas pa'i dkyil nas grangs med thub pa'i dbang //
translated: the five amṛtas, from which the countless buddhas arise,

original: ye shes bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin brtsams te yi ge h'um bkod rdo rje dam pa'i lce //
analyzed: ye shes bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin brtsams te yi ge h'um bkod rdo rje dam pa'i lce //
translated: the nature of the wisdom amṛta, the syllable hūṃ, the tongue of the sublime vajra.

original: snying ga'i zla ba'i dbus su ma lus rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor de yis tshim par bya //
analyzed: snying ga'i zla ba'i dbus su ma lus rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor de yis tshim par bya //
translated: In the center of the moon in the heart, the maṇḍala of all victors is satisfied by that.

original: kun du 'khrul pa spangs pa'i snying gi 'od zer las byung thub dbang mtha' yas kyi //
analyzed: kun du 'khrul pa spangs pa'i snying gi 'od zer las byung thub dbang mtha' yas kyi //
translated: The infinite Buddhas, born of the rays of the heart that has abandoned all error,

original: 'gro ba ma lus yang dag sangs rgyas byed pa bzhi yi sngags nang thim par bya //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus yang dag sangs rgyas byed pa bzhi yi sngags nang thim par bya //
translated: Dissolve into the four mantras, which awaken all beings without exception.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par grol bas mngon sum gyis ni mthong min de 'dzin pa //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par grol bas mngon sum gyis ni mthong min de 'dzin pa //
translated: The liberated eye does not see the object, but it sees the subject.

original: gzung ba 'ga' yang med de gzhan yang yod pa ma yin 'brel pa ma mthong bas //
analyzed: gzung ba 'ga' yang med de gzhan yang yod pa ma yin 'brel pa ma mthong bas //
translated: There is no object to be grasped, nor is there a subject, since no relation is perceived.

original: sim pa la sogs rang gi las kyang 'ga' yang mthong de yongs bzung bas na //
analyzed: sim pa la sogs rang gi las kyang 'ga' yang mthong de yongs bzung bas na //
translated: The eye does not see its own action, such as the perception of blue, etc., nor does it see the object.

original: dus gcig 'brel bar gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du de dag gzung 'dzin med //
analyzed: dus gcig 'brel bar gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du de dag gzung 'dzin med //
translated: The eye and the object are not related as simultaneous, as in the case of form, etc.

original: dkar po la sogs gang gis dang por mthong ba de nyid dus gzhan mthong ba min //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs gang gis dang por mthong ba de nyid dus gzhan mthong ba min //
translated: The eye does not see the object that it saw at first, nor does it see the object that it does not see.

original: de gnyis phan tshun du yang mi mthun phyir na rtag tu sim la sogs pa bzhin //
analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun du yang mi mthun phyir na rtag tu sim la sogs pa bzhin //
translated: The eye and the object are not related as mutually incompatible, like pleasure and pain.

original: de nas bzlas pa byed 'dod sems kyis dngos kun bdag nyid rang sems bdag por ni //
analyzed: de nas bzlas pa byed 'dod sems kyis dngos kun bdag nyid rang sems bdag por ni //
translated: Then, wishing to perform the recitation, the wise one should visualize the mantra in his heart, which is the lord of all things,

original: byas nas sems kyi 'od zer ldan pa bzhi yi sngags ni mkhas pas bsgom par bya //
analyzed: byas nas sems kyi 'od zer ldan pa bzhi yi sngags ni mkhas pas bsgom par bya //
translated: endowed with the light rays of the mind.

original: 'phro bas sngags kyi rgyal po gsal bar gtong dang dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas bzlas nas su //
analyzed: 'phro bas sngags kyi rgyal po gsal bar gtong dang dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas bzlas nas su //
translated: Having recited, having emitted the king of mantras, having made it manifest, under the control of the power of stopping and sending forth,

original: sku la sogs pa rnams kyi spro ba'i rim gyis sam ni dus gcig byas pa yis //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa rnams kyi spro ba'i rim gyis sam ni dus gcig byas pa yis //
translated: by the process of emanating the body and so forth, or having done it all at once,

original: nam mkha'i nang du sku la sogs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis bkang bya ste //
analyzed: nam mkha'i nang du sku la sogs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis bkang bya ste //
translated: one should fill the sky with the light rays of the body and so forth.

original: gong ma bzhin du sna tshogs mchod sprin tshogs rnams de nas kun du dbyung bar bya //
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du sna tshogs mchod sprin tshogs rnams de nas kun du dbyung bar bya //
translated: Then, as before, one should emit everywhere the mass of various offering clouds.

original: mchog gi rig ma 'khyud pa bde ba chen po chags pas gzhan dbang mthong nas su //
analyzed: mchog gi rig ma 'khyud pa bde ba chen po chags pas gzhan dbang mthong nas su //
translated: Having seen the supreme knowledge consort embrace, the lord of the powerful one, overpowered by great passion,

original: rgyas pa thub pa'i dbang po'i rgyun ni rang gi lus la mthar ni thim par bya //
analyzed: rgyas pa thub pa'i dbang po'i rgyun ni rang gi lus la mthar ni thim par bya //
translated: the stream of the powerful one dissolves into one’s body in the end.

original: gzhi yi snying po de nyid sems dpas lus nyams zhan pas sems kyi spyod chung ba //
analyzed: gzhi yi snying po de nyid sems dpas lus nyams zhan pas sems kyi spyod chung ba //
translated: The essence of the ground, that very [nature], is the bodhisattva.

original: rig ma mchog gi dbyangs kyis rab tu gsol ba btab nas dkyil 'khor mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: rig ma mchog gi dbyangs kyis rab tu gsol ba btab nas dkyil 'khor mchod par bya'o //
translated: Having made a request with the sound of the supreme knowledge consort, one should make offerings to the maṇḍala.

original: dam pa'i sems kyi chu rgyun 'gags pa'i dbugs kyi 'od zer lcags kyus drangs nas su //
analyzed: dam pa'i sems kyi chu rgyun 'gags pa'i dbugs kyi 'od zer lcags kyus drangs nas su //
translated: Having drawn with the hook of the light rays of the breath the stream of the water of the supreme mind that has been stopped,

original: lus nyam chung na cho ga bzhin du sku yi rdo rje sogs la dbab par bya //
analyzed: lus nyam chung na cho ga bzhin du sku yi rdo rje sogs la dbab par bya //
translated: if the body is weak, one should visualize the descent of the vajra body, and so on, according to the rite.

original: de ltar skad cig 'dug nas gong nas gsungs pa'i cho ga yis ni de bzhin nyid shes pas //
analyzed: de ltar skad cig 'dug nas gong nas gsungs pa'i cho ga yis ni de bzhin nyid shes pas //
translated: In that way, having remained for an instant, the one who knows suchness with the rite that was previously taught

original: dam pa'i sngags kyis bzlas pa @41a * //
analyzed: dam pa'i sngags kyis bzlas pa @41a * //
translated: recites the mantra of the supreme one.🔽One should do [this] day and night without interruption.

original: nyin mtshan med par bya'o sngags kyang ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: nyin mtshan med par bya'o sngags kyang ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: The mantra is not mixed.

original: gsungs pa'i bstod dang mchod la sogs pa rdzogs par bskyed pa brtson pa'i sngags pa yis //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i bstod dang mchod la sogs pa rdzogs par bskyed pa brtson pa'i sngags pa yis //
translated: The mantra practitioner who is diligent in the complete generation of the praise, offerings, and so on that were taught

original: phyag 'tshal la sogs bkod pa'i dkyil 'khor sku la sogs par rtog pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal la sogs bkod pa'i dkyil 'khor sku la sogs par rtog pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: should meditate on the maṇḍala array of prostration and so on in the body and so forth.

original: de 'dra'i cho ga de nyid mthong bas sems can khams ni nges dgrol dmigs nas su //
analyzed: de 'dra'i cho ga de nyid mthong bas sems can khams ni nges dgrol dmigs nas su //
translated: Having seen that very rite, and having observed the realm of sentient beings,

original: snying rjes 'gro la phan don brtan pa'i sems kyis cho ga 'di yis 'jig rten phan pa'i rgyu phyir 'byung bar bya //
analyzed: snying rjes 'gro la phan don brtan pa'i sems kyis cho ga 'di yis 'jig rten phan pa'i rgyu phyir 'byung bar bya //
translated: one should generate the rite with a mind firm in compassion for the sake of the benefit of beings, for the sake of the world’s welfare.

original: badzra dhrik ces bskul nas thugs kyi rdo rje 'gro ba'i don mchog byed pa ni //
analyzed: badzra dhrik ces bskul nas thugs kyi rdo rje 'gro ba'i don mchog byed pa ni //
translated: Having invoked Vajradhṛk, the Vajra of Mind, who performs the supreme benefit of beings,🔽[one should visualize him] with a white and red face on the right and left, and a supreme blue face blazing like a jewel,

original: g-yas g-yon zhal ni dkar dmar 'bar ba'i mthing ga dam pa nor bu 'dra ba'i mdog / mchog gi dang po bzhin du phyag dang ldan pa du ma'i mdog gi 'od kyi tshogs //
analyzed: g-yas g-yon zhal ni dkar dmar 'bar ba'i mthing ga dam pa nor bu 'dra ba'i mdog / mchog gi dang po bzhin du phyag dang ldan pa du ma'i mdog gi 'od kyi tshogs //
translated: with many hands like the supreme first one, with a mass of light of various colors,

original: 'dus nas bdag la blo dang ldan pas dngos po kun gyis thim par bya //
analyzed: 'dus nas bdag la blo dang ldan pas dngos po kun gyis thim par bya //
translated: and having gathered, with a wise mind, one should dissolve all things into oneself.

original: dzi na dzi ka ces bskul ba'i rdo rje 'dzin ltar mdog dang zhal sogs ldan //
analyzed: dzi na dzi ka ces bskul ba'i rdo rje 'dzin ltar mdog dang zhal sogs ldan //
translated: Having invoked Jinajik, one should visualize him like Vajradhara, with the same color, faces, and so forth,

original: shar gyi zla ba padma'i dbus su 'khor sogs mtshan pa de bzhin bsam //
analyzed: shar gyi zla ba padma'i dbus su 'khor sogs mtshan pa de bzhin bsam //
translated: in the east, in the center of a moon and lotus, marked with a wheel, and so forth.

original: ratna dhrik ces lho ru rin chen dbang phyug zhal rnams gzhon nu'i mdog 'dra ba //
analyzed: ratna dhrik ces lho ru rin chen dbang phyug zhal rnams gzhon nu'i mdog 'dra ba //
translated: Ratnadhrk in the south, Ratneśvara, with faces like a youth,

original: btso ma'i gser dang 'dra ba margad rin chen la sogs mdzes pa'i phyag drug pa //
analyzed: btso ma'i gser dang 'dra ba margad rin chen la sogs mdzes pa'i phyag drug pa //
translated: with six hands beautiful with jewels such as beryl and refined gold,

original: a'a ro li ka ces padma r'a ga bzhin du dmar la zhal gnyis de bzhin te //
analyzed: a'a ro li ka ces padma r'a ga bzhin du dmar la zhal gnyis de bzhin te //
translated: Ārolik in the west, with two faces like a lotus and ruby,

original: snang ba mtha' yas 'bar ba 'od ldan nub tu padma la sogs mtshan pa'i phyag / ma ra ga ta'i nor bu lta bu sngon bzhin la sogs phun sum tshogs ldan pa //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas 'bar ba 'od ldan nub tu padma la sogs mtshan pa'i phyag / ma ra ga ta'i nor bu lta bu sngon bzhin la sogs phun sum tshogs ldan pa //
translated: with hands marked by lotuses and so on, blazing with the light of Amitābha,

original: byang du don yod ces pa pra dzny'a dhrik ces ral gril sogs rnam ldan pa //
analyzed: byang du don yod ces pa pra dzny'a dhrik ces ral gril sogs rnam ldan pa //
translated: Prajñādhṛk in the north, Amoghasiddhi, with a sword and so on,

original: mdzes pa'i ral pa'i dbu rgyan sna tshogs rin chen 'od kyis rab brgyan pa //
analyzed: mdzes pa'i ral pa'i dbu rgyan sna tshogs rin chen 'od kyis rab brgyan pa //
translated: with a beautiful topknot, adorned with the light of various jewels,

original: rig ma dang bcas lus can thams cad nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ni bsam par bya //
analyzed: rig ma dang bcas lus can thams cad nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ni bsam par bya //
translated: together with the knowledge consorts, all embodied beings should be contemplated on the sun maṇḍala.

original: me yi phyogs mtshams su ni mo ha ra t'i zhes pas lha mo spyan mar gyur //
analyzed: me yi phyogs mtshams su ni mo ha ra t'i zhes pas lha mo spyan mar gyur //
translated: In the southeast, from moharati, the goddess Locanā arises,

original: bzlas pa rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas mchog gi 'jo sgeg sku yi rdo rje'i mdog / bden bral dag la sgeg mo thugs kyi dbang phyug lta bur mdzes pa'i zhal //
analyzed: bzlas pa rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas mchog gi 'jo sgeg sku yi rdo rje'i mdog / bden bral dag la sgeg mo thugs kyi dbang phyug lta bur mdzes pa'i zhal //
translated: The supreme beauty of the mandala of the completion of the repetition, the color of Vajra Body, is in the southwest, like the beautiful face of the Lady of the Mind.

original: dve sha ra t'i zhes pas dga' ba mchog tu spro ba m'a ma k'i zhes bya //
analyzed: dve sha ra t'i zhes pas dga' ba mchog tu spro ba m'a ma k'i zhes bya //
translated: The one called Vajra Speech is the supreme joy, the one called Mamaki,

original: ngag dbang dri med sku ni r'a ga ra t'i zhes ni re zhig bsam pa la //
analyzed: ngag dbang dri med sku ni r'a ga ra t'i zhes ni re zhig bsam pa la //
translated: the one called Vajra Mind is the stainless body, the one called Ragarati,

original: sems kyi dri med ngo bo nyid pas sangs rgyas kun gyi gzugs //
analyzed: sems kyi dri med ngo bo nyid pas sangs rgyas kun gyi gzugs //
translated: the stainless nature of the mind, the form of all the Buddhas.

original: de nyid dag dang sbyor bas dkyil 'khor bdag po nyid du cher gnas de dag go //
analyzed: de nyid dag dang sbyor bas dkyil 'khor bdag po nyid du cher gnas de dag go //
translated: The one called Vajra Dharma is the supreme abode of the mandala, the lord of the mandala, by the union with that very purity.

original: gzugs sogs 'khrul dang bral @41b bas dri med la sogs dngos grub pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs sogs 'khrul dang bral @41b bas dri med la sogs dngos grub pa'o //
translated: The one called Vajra Action is the accomplishment of the stainless, etc., by being free from the error of form, etc.

original: ser sna la sogs 'das pas grub pa'i pha rol phyin dang sa dang dkar ba'i chos kyi dbyings //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs 'das pas grub pa'i pha rol phyin dang sa dang dkar ba'i chos kyi dbyings //
translated: The one called Vajra Pledges is the perfection of the transcendent, the stage, and the pure element of the Dharma, by passing beyond miserliness, etc.

original: rnam par rtog med bdag gzhan 'byung ba'i rkyen nyid rim pa la'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog med bdag gzhan 'byung ba'i rkyen nyid rim pa la'o //
translated: The one called Vajra Lineage is the condition for the arising of the nonconceptual, self and other, in order.

original: zab cing rgya che nyid kyang thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid du ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che nyid kyang thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid du ni sems pa'o //
translated: The profound and vast are contemplated as the nature of method and wisdom.

original: don dam par yang dbyer med dbyer med ma yin kha cig 'dod de gzhan phyir na //
analyzed: don dam par yang dbyer med dbyer med ma yin kha cig 'dod de gzhan phyir na //
translated: Some assert that ultimately they are inseparable, and not inseparable, for other reasons.

original: gzhan du gzung ba'i gnas med phyir dang de bzhin dbye sogs rtogs pa'i mi 'byor phyir //🔽de ltar brtags nas zhi ba'i snying po dri med zla bar gnas pa'i mtshan ma'i dbus gnas pa'i //
analyzed: gzhan du gzung ba'i gnas med phyir dang de bzhin dbye sogs rtogs pa'i mi 'byor phyir // de ltar brtags nas zhi ba'i snying po dri med zla bar gnas pa'i mtshan ma'i dbus gnas pa'i //
translated: Because there is no other basis for apprehending, and because of the impossibility of realizing distinctions, etc.

original: dam pa'i sngags kyi thig le'i gzugs su rang gi sems ni 'od ldan bsgom par bya //
analyzed: dam pa'i sngags kyi thig le'i gzugs su rang gi sems ni 'od ldan bsgom par bya //
translated: Having contemplated in that way, one’s mind, endowed with light, is meditated upon as the form of the sublime mantra’s drop, abiding in the middle of the sign, in the stainless moon, the essence of peace.

original: sems de'i 'od zer phreng bas sku gsung rdo rje mchog gi lus la gsal byas nas //
analyzed: sems de'i 'od zer phreng bas sku gsung rdo rje mchog gi lus la gsal byas nas //
translated: The body of the supreme vajra body, speech, and mind is illuminated by the garland of light rays of that mind.

original: de nas lus nang thams cad gsal bar byas nas kun du de nyid mtha' yas pas //
analyzed: de nas lus nang thams cad gsal bar byas nas kun du de nyid mtha' yas pas //
translated: Then, having illuminated the entire body, it is everywhere infinite.

original: so sor ba spu las byung 'od kyis de yis sna tshogs kun du gang byas te //
analyzed: so sor ba spu las byung 'od kyis de yis sna tshogs kun du gang byas te //
translated: The light that arises from each pore fills everything with its variety.

original: slar yang de nyid du ni thim ste ye shes bdud rtsi'i rgyun ni bsgom par bya //
analyzed: slar yang de nyid du ni thim ste ye shes bdud rtsi'i rgyun ni bsgom par bya //
translated: Again, it dissolves into that, and one should meditate on the stream of the elixir of timeless awareness.

original: yang na rang gi phyag mtshan phra mo gsal ba sna rtse ra gnas par bsgom par bya //
analyzed: yang na rang gi phyag mtshan phra mo gsal ba sna rtse ra gnas par bsgom par bya //
translated: Or else, one should meditate on the clear, subtle form of one’s hand implement abiding at the tip of the nose.

original: nang du thub pa'i dkyil 'khor snying rje can gyis nyin mtshan dam pa'i shes rab ldan //
analyzed: nang du thub pa'i dkyil 'khor snying rje can gyis nyin mtshan dam pa'i shes rab ldan //
translated: Inside, the compassionate maṇḍala of sages, endowed with the wisdom of the day and night,🔽having seen the signs of stability, the emanation, the light rays from the lord of sages,

original: brtan pa'i mtshan ma mthong nas spro ba de yi 'od zer thub dbang las byung dang // rnam pa sna tshogs phyag mtshan rnams kyang yang dang yang du blo dang ldan par bya //
analyzed: brtan pa'i mtshan ma mthong nas spro ba de yi 'od zer thub dbang las byung dang // rnam pa sna tshogs phyag mtshan rnams kyang yang dang yang du blo dang ldan par bya //
translated: and the various hand implements, again and again, should be made intelligent.

original: bsdu ba bsngo dang smon lam rnams ni sngon du bya //
analyzed: bsdu ba bsngo dang smon lam rnams ni sngon du bya //
translated: The conclusion, dedication, and aspiration should be done beforehand.

original: langs nas dag pa'i sems dpa' rang gi lha yi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i sems ldan pa //
analyzed: langs nas dag pa'i sems dpa' rang gi lha yi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i sems ldan pa //
translated: Having arisen, the pure being, endowed with the mind that holds the form of one’s deity,

original: yul las gsal ba la gnas gong ma bzhin du yongs su bsgoms nas yul rnams kyang //
analyzed: yul las gsal ba la gnas gong ma bzhin du yongs su bsgoms nas yul rnams kyang //
translated: having completely meditated on the object as clear and abiding, as before,

original: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rjer gyur pa go rims rang gi rang bzhin dag pa yis //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i rdo rjer gyur pa go rims rang gi rang bzhin dag pa yis //
translated: the object also becomes the vajra of body, and so on, in order, with one’s own nature.

original: chos nyid kyis ni dpal ldan rdo rje 'dzin pa lta bur gzhan dang gzhan du dbyer med chos //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis ni dpal ldan rdo rje 'dzin pa lta bur gzhan dang gzhan du dbyer med chos //
translated: By nature, he is indivisible from the glorious Vajradhara.

original: thams cad bya ba bya'o phyin ci log pa'i rtog pa las ni grol ba yi //
analyzed: thams cad bya ba bya'o phyin ci log pa'i rtog pa las ni grol ba yi //
translated: He is liberated from the false imagination of the various activities of all.

original: thub pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad mchod pa'i mchog 'di dag gis rtag tu de yis so //
analyzed: thub pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad mchod pa'i mchog 'di dag gis rtag tu de yis so //
translated: He always makes offerings to the maṇḍala of the Sage with these supreme offerings.

original: bza' ba'i dus na snying ga ru ni gzhi yis bon rnams ni dmigs nas su //
analyzed: bza' ba'i dus na snying ga ru ni gzhi yis bon rnams ni dmigs nas su //
translated: At the time of eating, he visualizes the seed syllables at the heart,

original: byang chub sems dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin kun du 'od zer 'bar ba bsam par bya //
analyzed: byang chub sems dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin kun du 'od zer 'bar ba bsam par bya //
translated: and imagines the nature of bodhicitta blazing with light.

original: thams cad mnyam nyid dag pa'i bza' ba de nyid gsum gyi sngags ni gdab byas te //🔽des ni sku yi @42a * //
analyzed: thams cad mnyam nyid dag pa'i bza' ba de nyid gsum gyi sngags ni gdab byas te // des ni sku yi @42a * //
translated: He consecrates the food, which is pure and equal to everything, with the mantra of the three syllables.🔽He satisfies the deities such as Vajra Body

original: rdo rje la sogs lha rnams rab tu tshim par bya //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs lha rnams rab tu tshim par bya //
translated: with that.

original: phyi yi sbyin srog cho ga rjes su dpag tsam yid las byung ba'i sems nyid de //
analyzed: phyi yi sbyin srog cho ga rjes su dpag tsam yid las byung ba'i sems nyid de //
translated: The outer fire offering is merely an imitation, arisen from the mind.

original: phung po la sogs bud shing bsregs nas ye shes me sbar ba ni bla med gsungs //
analyzed: phung po la sogs bud shing bsregs nas ye shes me sbar ba ni bla med gsungs //
translated: It is said that the fire of gnosis is ignited by burning the fuel of the aggregates and so on.

original: de ltar thams cad 'dod pa rnams kyis bdag la rang rang lha yi gzugs nyid la //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad 'dod pa rnams kyis bdag la rang rang lha yi gzugs nyid la //
translated: In this way, all those who desire it should worship me in the form of the deity itself.

original: mchod par bya ba gzhan yang dam tshig der ni bde bar gshegs rnams 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: mchod par bya ba gzhan yang dam tshig der ni bde bar gshegs rnams 'dod pa yin //
translated: Moreover, the Sugatas desire that the samaya be worshipped.

original: rjes su rig pa 'gro ba'i don dang bde gshegs kun la mchod pa yang byas te //
analyzed: rjes su rig pa 'gro ba'i don dang bde gshegs kun la mchod pa yang byas te //
translated: Having worshipped the Sugatas and benefited migrating beings with subsequent knowledge,

original: lus la sogs pa'i las kyang de bzhin rtag tu mnyam par gzhag par bya ba yin //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i las kyang de bzhin rtag tu mnyam par gzhag par bya ba yin //
translated: one should also always be equipoised in the actions of body and so on.

original: de 'dra'i rnam pa'i sems la 'ga' zhig lus ngag dngos kyi las ni gang yin pa //
analyzed: de 'dra'i rnam pa'i sems la 'ga' zhig lus ngag dngos kyi las ni gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever actions of body and speech there are in a mind of such a type,

original: de dag thams cad phyag rgya'i sngags kyi rnam par sangs rgyas kyis ni gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: de dag thams cad phyag rgya'i sngags kyi rnam par sangs rgyas kyis ni gsungs pa yin //
translated: all of them are said by the Buddha to be the form of mantra and mudra.

original: gcig pu kho na'i gzhi la sna tshogs rtog pas bsags pa'i rnam pa de rnams ni //
analyzed: gcig pu kho na'i gzhi la sna tshogs rtog pas bsags pa'i rnam pa de rnams ni //
translated: Those aspects that are accumulated by various concepts in the sole basis

original: sdug bsngal bde ba grol ba bskyed pa las ni khyad par ci yi phyir //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bde ba grol ba bskyed pa las ni khyad par ci yi phyir //
translated: are the cause of the production of suffering, happiness, and liberation.

original: dge dang mi dge'i rnam pas lus la sogs pa sems kyi dbang gi phyir zhes gsungs //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge'i rnam pas lus la sogs pa sems kyi dbang gi phyir zhes gsungs //
translated: “By the power of the mind, the body and so forth are made virtuous or nonvirtuous.”

original: bde bas nyes pa thams cad spangs pa'i sems la nag po'i lus su gyur //
analyzed: bde bas nyes pa thams cad spangs pa'i sems la nag po'i lus su gyur //
translated: By the bliss of the mind, all faults are abandoned.

original: dam tshig zad ma thag tu ji bzhin snying zlar bzhag pa'i rdo rje rgya gram sems //
analyzed: dam tshig zad ma thag tu ji bzhin snying zlar bzhag pa'i rdo rje rgya gram sems //
translated: Immediately after the exhaustion of the commitments, the vajra cross is placed in the heart as before.

original: dpal ldan dam tshig rdo rje'i sbyor bas rang bzhin rnam dag 'gro ba bsams nas ni //
analyzed: dpal ldan dam tshig rdo rje'i sbyor bas rang bzhin rnam dag 'gro ba bsams nas ni //
translated: Having contemplated the pure nature of beings by the union of glorious Samayavajra,

original: sna tshogs padma'i dbus su gong ma'i rim pas dbang bskur ba ni bsgom par bya //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma'i dbus su gong ma'i rim pas dbang bskur ba ni bsgom par bya //
translated: one should meditate on the consecration in the center of the variegated lotus, in the proper order.

original: phyi yi khrus kyi cho gal yang rim pa 'di dag khyad par du ni bsam srid kyi //
analyzed: phyi yi khrus kyi cho gal yang rim pa 'di dag khyad par du ni bsam srid kyi //
translated: Although the outer bathing ritual also has these stages, they are particularly intended.

original: mtshams la'ang de bzhin mchod pa la sogs sngon du byas nas bzlas byas te //
analyzed: mtshams la'ang de bzhin mchod pa la sogs sngon du byas nas bzlas byas te //
translated: Having performed the offerings and so forth in the same way in the intermediate state, one should recite.

original: sems kyi nang du gnas pa'i 'khor los shes rab snying rjer ldan pas nyal bar bya //
analyzed: sems kyi nang du gnas pa'i 'khor los shes rab snying rjer ldan pas nyal bar bya //
translated: One should sleep with the mind abiding in the inner wheel, endowed with wisdom and compassion.

original: tho rangs langs pa'i dus na lha mo rnams kyi dbyangs kyis bskul nas dpal ldan pas //
analyzed: tho rangs langs pa'i dus na lha mo rnams kyi dbyangs kyis bskul nas dpal ldan pas //
translated: At dawn, when one rises, one is urged by the songs of the goddesses.

original: byas nas langs te thub pas bzlas pa la sogs gong ma'i cho ga nyid kyis bya //
analyzed: byas nas langs te thub pas bzlas pa la sogs gong ma'i cho ga nyid kyis bya //
translated: Having done that, one rises and performs the recitation and so forth with the rite as before.

original: grub pa'i mtshan ma thob bas de nyid gsum gyi mchod pa'i cho ga byas nas zhi sems la //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtshan ma thob bas de nyid gsum gyi mchod pa'i cho ga byas nas zhi sems la //
translated: Having obtained the sign of accomplishment, one performs the rite of worship of the three realities and then

original: gong nas gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pas ni 'dod pa'i dngos grub 'grub //
analyzed: gong nas gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pas ni 'dod pa'i dngos grub 'grub //
translated: one should abide in the maṇḍala as previously taught and accomplish the desired powers.

original: bdud rtsi zhes pa'i dkyil 'khor la ni dbang bskur byas te nan tan dgra gzhom bya //
analyzed: bdud rtsi zhes pa'i dkyil 'khor la ni dbang bskur byas te nan tan dgra gzhom bya //
translated: In the maṇḍala called “nectar,” one should perform the consecration and strive to destroy one’s enemies.

original: gang zhig de yi dbus la gnas te gyur pa de ni de yi 'khor lo yin //
analyzed: gang zhig de yi dbus la gnas te gyur pa de ni de yi 'khor lo yin //
translated: One who abides in its center is in its maṇḍala.

original: sgyu ma rnam par rtog par gyur las @42b gzhan 'ga' 'ang srid pa'i sdug bsngal yod pa med //
analyzed: sgyu ma rnam par rtog par gyur las @42b gzhan 'ga' 'ang srid pa'i sdug bsngal yod pa med //
translated: There is no other existence of suffering than the conceptualization of an illusion.

original: de dang mi mthun pa ni de dag sems dpa' mngon sum du ni byang chub shes par bya //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa ni de dag sems dpa' mngon sum du ni byang chub shes par bya //
translated: One should know that the enlightenment of those who are not in accord with that is manifest in their minds.

original: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid de la gang yang snang ba ma yin rtog med pas //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid de la gang yang snang ba ma yin rtog med pas //
translated: To him, whose nature is method and wisdom, nothing appears, because he is nonconceptual.

original: kun rdzob pa las lhag pa gzhan ni med do zhes te grub par sngar byas so //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa las lhag pa gzhan ni med do zhes te grub par sngar byas so //
translated: There is no other reality than the conventional, as was established earlier.

original: gang dag gang zhig mi mthun dus gcig 'gyur bde gsal mchog gyur ci yi phyir /
analyzed: gang dag gang zhig mi mthun dus gcig 'gyur bde gsal mchog gyur ci yi phyir /
translated: If something is incompatible with something else, how can they occur at the same time?

original: mthong ba goms pa 'phel ba'i phyir na rang gi mi mthun gtan du 'gag pa yin //
analyzed: mthong ba goms pa 'phel ba'i phyir na rang gi mi mthun gtan du 'gag pa yin //
translated: If seeing increases through familiarity, then its incompatible [object] is permanently blocked.

original: rgyu yi gzhi yi ngo bo rnams la bdag med ldan yang sben la sogs pa ni //
